summary: This document is an email chain regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case, indicating the Deputy Attorney General has determined federal prosecution is appropriate and setting a deadline of June 30, 2008, for Epstein to comply with a plea agreement, including pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

persons.name: Jack Goldbeer
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial email, agreeing to be conferenced into a call at 3:30 regarding the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Roy
persons.context: Addressed in the forwarded email regarding the Epstein matter and a list of issues to discuss.

persons.name: Jeff Sloman
persons.context: Contacted the email sender and asked them to return Roy's call regarding the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Recipient of an email stating the Deputy Attorney General's determination on the Epstein case and the deadline for Epstein's compliance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; the Deputy Attorney General has determined federal prosecution is appropriate, and he has a deadline to comply with a plea agreement.

connections.description: Jeff Sloman contacted the email sender to return Roy's call regarding the Epstein matter.
Jay Lefkowitz is being communicated with regarding the legal terms and deadline for Jeffrey Epstein's case.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's Plea Agreement Compliance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has until the close of business to comply with the terms of the agreement with the United States, including entering a guilty plea, sentencing, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

events.title: Email Correspondence on Epstein Case
events.description: Email chain discusses the Deputy Attorney General's review completion and the impending deadline for Epstein's legal compliance.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein is appropriate.
Epstein had a deadline of June 30, 2008, to comply with a modified plea agreement, which included pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to prison.
The communication involves Assistant U.S. Attorney Jeff Sloman and attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding the legal proceedings.
The document references a prior letter from the U.S. Attorney dated December 19th that modified the agreement with Epstein.
